language_style_full_name: Archaic and Formal Biblical English (KJV, Geneva, Bishop's Bible, etc.)

stories.story_title: Creation Week: God's Grand Opening
stories.summary: In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth, and in six days made all things orderly and perfect, resting upon the seventh day which he sanctified.

stories.story_title: Eden: Paradise Lost in One Bite
stories.summary: The Lord God formed man in his own image and placed him in the garden of Eden, yet through the serpent's subtlety man transgressed, and was cast out to labour and sorrow.

stories.story_title: Cain & Abel: First Blood, First Blame
stories.summary: Cain's offering was not accepted of the Lord, for he lacked the blood sacrifice which God requireth; in anger he slew his brother Abel, yet God set a mark upon him for preservation.

stories.story_title: Patriarchs of Old: The Long View
stories.summary: The patriarchs lived in great longevity from Adam unto Noah; Enoch alone walked with God and was translated without death, whilst corruption multiplied amongst men.

stories.story_title: The Corruption Deepens: Prelude to Flood
stories.summary: The sons of God took wives of men, and giants were born; the earth became full of wickedness, yet Noah found grace in the eyes of the Lord.

stories.story_title: Noah's Ark: Floodgates of Fury and Favor
stories.summary: God commanded Noah to build an ark and preserve all flesh through the waters of judgment; the flood covered the earth, yet the Lord remembered Noah and made a covenant with the rainbow as a sign.

stories.story_title: Nations Scattered: Table and Confusion
stories.summary: Noah's sons did multiply and spread throughout the earth; yet when men sought to reach unto heaven in pride, God confounded their speech and scattered them abroad.

stories.story_title: The Narrowing Begins: Genealogy to Abram
stories.summary: From Shem's line was born the genealogy descending unto Terah and his son Abram; the focus narroweth from all nations unto one family chosen for covenant.

stories.story_title: Abram's Call: Stranger Becomes Star-Dust Father
stories.summary: The Lord called Abram to depart from his kindred and country, promising to make him a great nation; Abram believed and journeyed to Canaan to build altars unto the Lord.

stories.story_title: Egypt and Lot: First Tests of Faith
stories.summary: Famine drove Abram to Egypt, where he lacked faith and said his wife was his sister; yet God preserved her, and Abram returned enriched but separated from Lot due to strife.

stories.story_title: War, Rescue, and Priestly Blessing
stories.summary: Kings made war and took Lot captive; Abram pursued and rescued him, then was met by Melchizedek, priest of the Most High, who blessed him and received tithes.

stories.story_title: Covenant Vision: Stars, Fire, and Prophecy
stories.summary: God appeared unto Abram in a vision and promised him seed as the stars, counting his faith for righteousness; he made a covenant and prophesied Egypt's bondage.

stories.story_title: Hagar and Ishmael: Human Plans vs. Divine Promise
stories.summary: Sarai gave Hagar to Abram after the flesh, and Ishmael was born; yet God's covenant was established with Abraham through circumcision, and Isaac was promised though Sarah laughed.

stories.story_title: Sodom's Mercy Boundary: Hospitality and Judgment
stories.summary: The Lord appeared unto Abraham with visitors; he showed great hospitality and interceded for Sodom, yet the city had transgressed and was destroyed with fire and brimstone.

stories.story_title: Abimelech and Deception Reprised
stories.summary: Abraham again said his wife was his sister to Abimelech; God warned Abimelech in a dream, and he restored Sarah with gifts, making a covenant with Abraham.

stories.story_title: Isaac Born: Promise Fulfilled, Ishmael Cast Out
stories.summary: Isaac was born when Abraham was 100 and Sarah 90, fulfilling the promise; Ishmael was cast out, yet God preserved him in the wilderness and made him a great nation.

stories.story_title: The Akedah: Ultimate Test of Faith
stories.summary: God commanded Abraham to offer Isaac his only son; Abraham obeyed without question, yet the Lord stayed his hand and provided a ram in his stead, reaffirming the covenant.

stories.story_title: Sarah's Death and Machpelah Purchase
stories.summary: Sarah died at 127 years; Abraham mourned and purchased the cave of Machpelah for her burial, securing the first inheritance of the promised land.

stories.story_title: Isaac's Bride: Rebekah Chosen by Providence
stories.summary: Abraham sent his servant to find a bride for Isaac from his kindred; the servant prayed at the well, and God answered by bringing forth Rebekah, who was taken to wife by Isaac.

stories.story_title: Abraham's Legacy: Death and Ishmael
stories.summary: Abraham died at 175 years, old and satisfied; his covenant was transferred unto Isaac alone, whilst Ishmael's line was established as a great nation apart.

stories.story_title: Twins and Birthright: Esau's Hunger
stories.summary: Isaac's wife conceived twins, and God revealed that the elder would serve the younger; Esau despised his birthright and sold it to Jacob for pottage.

stories.story_title: Isaac in Gerar: Tested Promises and Disputes
stories.summary: Isaac went to Gerar during famine, repeated his father's deception about his wife, yet prospered greatly; he dug wells and made covenants, though his son Esau grieved him with Hittite wives.

stories.story_title: Jacob's Theft: Disguise and Blessing Stolen
stories.summary: Isaac, being old and blind, blessed Jacob in Esau's stead through deception and disguise; Esau's rage forced Jacob to flee to Haran to escape his brother's vengeance.

stories.story_title: Jacob's Dream: Ladder to Heaven
stories.summary: Jacob fled toward Haran and dreamed of a ladder reaching unto heaven; the Lord appeared and renewed the covenant, and Jacob vowed to give tithes and make that stone his house.

stories.story_title: Jacob in Mesopotamia: Laboring for Family
stories.summary: Jacob labored fourteen years for Rachel, was deceived with Leah, and through his wives bore twelve sons; his cunning with cattle made him wealthy, though Laban envied him.

stories.story_title: Jacob's Flight: Stolen Idols and Covenant
stories.summary: Jacob fled from Laban with all he had, whilst Rachel stole her father's idols; Laban pursued but could not find them, and they made a covenant at Galeed before parting.

stories.story_title: Peniel: Wrestled by God, Named Israel
stories.summary: Jacob wrestled with a Man until daybreak and prevailed; through this wrestling he was renamed Israel, and his hip was touched; he reconciled with Esau and settled in Canaan.

stories.story_title: Dinah's Defilement: Vengeance and Purification
stories.summary: Dinah was defiled by Shechem; Jacob's sons deceived the city with circumcision and slew all the males; Jacob returned to Bethel to purify his house and renew the covenant.

stories.story_title: Esau's Line: Edom Separated and Recorded
stories.summary: Esau's genealogy was recorded, showing the rejected line that would become Edom and dwell in Mount Seir, whilst Jacob alone carried forward the covenant unto all generations.

stories.story_title: Joseph's Dreams: Beloved Son Betrayed
stories.summary: Joseph's dreams of dominance incited his brothers' hatred; they stripped him of his coat of colours and sold him unto Midianite traders who brought him into Egypt as a slave.

stories.story_title: Judah and Tamar: Redemptive Interlude
stories.summary: Judah's sons died for their wickedness; Tamar, denied her right to Shelah, disguised herself and bore twins unto Judah, preserving the line that would lead to David.

stories.story_title: Joseph in Egypt: Virtue Amid Temptation
stories.summary: Joseph found favour in Potiphar's sight and was made overseer, yet resisted the temptation of his master's wife; falsely accused, he was imprisoned yet blessed by the Lord.

stories.story_title: Pharaoh's Dreams: Joseph's Exaltation
stories.summary: Pharaoh dreamed of famine and plenty; Joseph interpreted the dreams and revealed the Spirit of God upon him; he was exalted to rule over Egypt and prepare for the coming famine.

stories.story_title: Famine's Test: Brothers Descend for Grain
stories.summary: Famine came upon the land; Jacob sent his sons to Egypt for grain, where Joseph tested them, keeping Simeon as surety and returning their money in their sacks.

stories.story_title: Benjamin's Journey: The Cup Test Deepens
stories.summary: Jacob sent Benjamin with his brothers; Joseph placed his cup in Benjamin's sack and accused him of theft; Judah offered himself in Benjamin's stead, showing genuine repentance.

stories.story_title: Reconciliation: Joseph Revealed and Egypt Received
stories.summary: Joseph revealed himself unto his brethren, saying God sent him to preserve life; he brought Jacob and all his house to Egypt to dwell in Goshen and be sustained through famine.

stories.story_title: Vayechi: Jacob's Blessing and the Promise Endures
stories.summary: Jacob blessed his twelve sons with tribal prophecies before his death; Joseph was assured that God would bring his people to the promised land, and he charged them to carry his bones to Canaan.
